image.altText: A Richmond AFL player holds the ball in two hands as he attempts to evade a West Coast opponent.

props.synopsis: West Coast adds Richmond's Liam Baker and Matthew Owies from Carlton as part of a deal that also sees the Eagles move down the AFL draft order from pick 3 to pick 12. Follow live.

title.children: Eagles send pick 3 to Blues in three-team trade to land Liam Baker and Matthew Owies

image.altText: A herd of sheep in a dry paddock on a farm.

props.synopsis: The federal government will provide an additional $32 million to help WA's sheep industry transition away from live exports, bringing the total support package to $139 million.

title.children: Backlash from WA farmers after live export ban prompts extra $32 million in federal government help

image.altText: A woman in a yellow hi-vis shirt crouches with her two children on the ground, while smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: The Wheatbelt town of Moora has been labelled a "childcare desert" as its only centre can hold 20 children. After receiving funding, the centre can now expand to 55 children in 2025.

title.children: With childcare places finally increasing Brittany can hold on to her dream job

image.altText: A big shark near a very small boat.

props.synopsis: An angler's close encounter with a 4-metre shark near the popular tourist town of Exmouth in Western Australia has created a flurry of excitement online.

title.children: Four-metre great white shark spotted in 'weirdly fantastic' sighting in WA's north

image.altText: A close up of the Premier wearing a white hard hat

props.synopsis: WA's Town of Port Hedland council has passed a motion urging state and federal governments to suspend COVID-19 vaccines, prompting the Premier to say they should "stick to their knitting" and stop spreading unverified claims.

title.children: 'Off the rails' council backs COVID conspiracy and calls for vaccines to be scrapped

image.altText: Belmont councillor and driving instructor Tamak Vijay walking down the stairs at a Perth court.

props.synopsis: A driving assessor and City of Belmont councillor is convicted of indecently assaulting three women while conducting their driving tests.

title.children: Driving assessor and Belmont city councillor guilty of indecently assaulting young women during tests

props.synopsis: Three years after a tiny pest began killing trees across Perth, authorities are sticking to one method — cutting down established trees in the hope of eradicating it. What will it take for the city to learn to live with the shot-hole borer?

title.children: 'No other country in the world has attempted to eradicate this': Is it time to change tack on the shot-hole borer?

image.altText: A teenage boy leaning against a wall holds his head in his hands and sobs with anguish

props.synopsis: Residents and refugees in the city of Jabalia are entering their 11th day under fire as part of a renewed push by the Israel Defense Forces. The IDF says it follows intelligence Hamas is "reforming in the area".

title.children: The controversial plan that retired generals think Israel needs for northern Gaza

image.altText: A house auction in Norwood

props.synopsis: It's a matter of when, not if, the Reserve Bank will take the knife to interest rates, but first home buyers may only see a fleeting, and possibly minuscule, improvement in affordability.

title.children: More wealth in fewer hands — the great housing rort

image.altText: People in a packed moshpit inside a tent with giant balloons put their hands up as a person on stage jumps up in the air.

props.synopsis: Freedom of Information documents reveal tens of millions of dollars in grants were given to global behemoth Live Nation at a time when Australia's music industry was struggling.

title.children: Music giant Live Nation earned $US23 billion last year. Australian governments have been giving it millions in grants

image.altText: A room with ocean views.

props.synopsis: The Copacabana property on the NSW Central Coast is touted as being "clifftop perfection" and features expansive ocean views.

title.children: Anthony Albanese buys $4.3 million clifftop property to be close to future wife's family

props.synopsis: Mental health, technology and artificial intelligence (AI): Here's what hundreds of students, parents and teachers are most concerned about when it comes to education.

title.children: 'This will break the community': Hundreds of students, parents and teachers told us what's wrong with our schools

image.altText: Smiling man sits on motorbike front of a roadhouse, arms in the air, victory sign, wears black tee, tatoos down arm.

props.synopsis: Steve Berente always loved the feeling of roaring down a red dirt highway. So when the death of his only child in a car crash near Mandurah left him aching with grief, he turned to his motorbike and made off for the country's wildest places.

title.children: How remote Australia helped Steve survive the death of his beloved daughter

image.altText: Cooper Hamilton

props.synopsis: One minute Cooper Hamilton was on an AFL list and chasing his dream. The next, he was writing 'unemployed' on a hospital form, in a scene that is incredibly familiar for professional footballers.

title.children: 'Dagger in the heart': What it's like to be told you won't receive another AFL contract

image.altText: Classroom chair knocked over

props.synopsis: Arduous paperwork, surveillance and bullying from management are among the challenges teachers say they face amid a nationwide education staff shortage.

title.children: 'I had a nervous breakdown': Abusive, bullying behaviour behind teaching exodus

image.altText: A drone that looks like an aeroplane flies through the air.

props.synopsis: Drones have changed the face of modern warfare and are being used from Ukraine to the Middle East, but can Australia keep up with the pace when it comes to its national defence strategy?

title.children: What Australia needs to learn from the drones dominating the Ukraine war

image.altText: A person holds a grey Visa card next to a black EFTPOS payment terminal

props.synopsis: There is an end in sight for consumers getting hit with sneaky surcharges when they pay on card, with the federal government prepared to ban the practice by 2026, promising to give consumers and small businesses "a fair go."

title.children: Debit card surcharges to be scrapped by 2026, government promises

image.altText: Anthony Albanese with Peter Dutton behind him. Both wear suits and have been digitally altered like you're wearing 3D glasses

props.synopsis: The outcome of two misleading assertions in 2022 reinforces what many in Australia have long suspected — that when it comes to the facts, there is one set of rules for politicians and another for everyone else.

title.children: Labor wants 'fundamental' electoral reform but noticeably absent from its plans are the biggest threats to democracy

image.altText: Vladimir Putin sits in a seat thinking while wearing a dark suit.

props.synopsis: An inquiry into the death of a British woman from Novichok in 2018 hears allegations Russian President Vladimir Putin approved the delivery of the lethal nerve agent to the UK for the poisoning of former Russian spy Sergei Skripal.

title.children: Ex-Russian spy says Putin authorised 2018 Novichok poisoning attack in England

image.altText: Two men in glasses hold the pregnant tummy of a smiling woman sitting between them surrounded by flowers and greenery.

props.synopsis: Joel Reeve is eagerly awaiting the birth of his son after a stranger he met online agreed to be a surrogate. But he had to move his entire life to Tasmania to become a father.

title.children: When Joel met Jess: An unconventional love story between strangers united by one man's fight for fatherhood

image.altText: Selfie of a man wearing a cap and safety gear inside a helicopter

props.synopsis: Being given just six months to live came as a shock to Craig Pankhurst because he assumed not hearing from the doctor about his most recent prostate-specific antigen test was a good thing. But it wasn't.

title.children: It shouldn't have taken a 'crook tooth' for Craig to learn he had life-threatening prostate cancer

image.altText: A woman stands holding a fan on the porch of a beach hut

props.synopsis: New Zealand's defence minister has dismissed calls for an apology, saying the NZ Defence Force was "deeply traumatised" by the sinking of HMNZS Manawanui.

title.children: Samoa says sunken ship spilled 200,000 litres of diesel but NZ minister describes it as 'a little trickle'

image.altText: A man's hand encloses an orange ball while blood flows from a needle and tube in his forearm.

props.synopsis: Josh Blizzard has a genetic condition called haemochromatosis, where his body absorbs too much iron. The prescribed treatment is to regularly remove blood, and the good news is it's safe for donation.

title.children: Tens of thousands of '100 per cent safe' bags of blood are being binned instead of donated

image.altText: A close up of whale carcass and boat in distance

props.synopsis: Locals videoed the dead whale being eaten by sharks as it made its way towards a popular swimming and surfing beach on Western Australia's south coast.

title.children: Whale carcass removed from beach as residents work fast to reduce shark risk

image.altText: Three CCTV cameras over the top of a barbed-wire fence seen through trees.

props.synopsis: There's one question at the heart of WA's youth justice problems. But the government's answer remains a long way off what even its own experts say.

title.children: There's a crucial question at the centre of WA's troubled youth justice system. The government's response to it is telling

image.altText: Shane Drumgold holding a folder walking into ACAT.

props.synopsis: The ACT Bar Council dismisses 10 complaints made about former ACT director of public prosecutions Shane Drumgold during his prosecution of former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann over the alleged rape of Brittany Higgins.

title.children: Complaints about the conduct of former ACT top prosecutor Shane Drumgold during Bruce Lehrmann trial dismissed

image.altText: Crocodile image captured by drone near Exmouth

props.synopsis: The hunt for a "problem" saltwater crocodile in one of Western Australia's most popular tourist towns has residents calling for stronger action against the feared creatures.

title.children: Two-metre croc in popular WA tourist spot a long way from home, putting locals on edge

image.altText: Brisbane Roar coach John Aloisi

props.synopsis: John Aloisi believes frustrating the Japanese into submission is one way the Socceroos can end their 15-year wait for a win over the Samurai Blue, and their first in Japan.

title.children: Socceroos look to end 15-year drought over Japan, with a former great backing new coach Popovic

image.altText: An older couple smile, standing in a kitchen holding kitchen utensils over a pot full of food.

props.synopsis: The latest Foodbank Hunger Report has found 3.4 million households across Australia are experiencing food insecurity, with low income earners having to skip meals or eat less because they cannot afford enough food.

title.children: Two million households in grip of 'severe' food insecurity, annual snapshot shows

image.altText: Brightly coloured coral and sponges cling to pylons under blue water, with black and white fish nearby.

props.synopsis: Scientists from the University of Western Australia are investigating the anti-cancer properties of sea sponges found under Busselton Jetty in Western Australia.

title.children: Sea sponges under WA tourist attraction could hold cancer-fighting compounds

image.altText: Sean "Diddy" Combs dressed in a suit and bowtie not smiling

props.synopsis: The latest accusers are among more than 100 other alleged victims who are in the process of taking legal action against the hip hop mogul.

title.children: Six new lawsuits accuse Sean 'Diddy' Combs of assaulting men, women and child

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Australian shares follow Wall Street higher, with Telstra in focus as it holds its annual general meeting. See how the day unfolds on the markets blog.

title.children: ASX opens at record high, Crown fined $2 million

image.altText: Dozens of people put their hands in the air at a concert.

props.synopsis: A legal firm says it is investigating allegations of "deceptive, misleading or unconscionable conduct". The ticketing company says it is not responsible for setting prices.

title.children: Ticketmaster and Live Nation could face class action from music fans over 'dynamic' ticket pricing

image.altText: A streak of white among a purple sky above green grass at night

props.synopsis: The phenomenon is not well understood, and an astrophysicist says it is hard to predict when and where Steve will appear next.

title.children: Photographers looking for Aurora Australis capture mysterious phenomenon Steve instead
